Vocabularies.Definition: together with 连同
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I took a friend along with me.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. every other or second; happening by turns 交替的；轮流的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I like this pattern of alternate circles and squares.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a feeling of worry or fear 忧虑，担心
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The increase in the tax on heating fuel is causing a lot of anxiety among elderly people.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (一)大捆，(一)大包
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The shed was filled with large round bales of hay.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 横杆；条；块
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It was a brick building with bars across the ground floor windows.

Vocabularies.Definition: feeling foolish or uncomfortable because of (sth.) 因…感到难为情
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She was so ashamed of cheating in the test that she went and told the teacher.

Vocabularies.Definition: prove that (sth.) is true 证实
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His version of events just isn't borne out by the facts.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 健美运动员
n. 微风，轻风
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   A gentle breeze was blowing.

Vocabularies.Definition: 使回到现实中
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Jack had been spending all his time chatting on line with his key-pals until his parents had a word with him and brought him back to earth.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 家庭杂务
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   My husband and I both go out to work, so we share the household chores.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （体育运动的）教练
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Tony Woodcock has joined German amateur team SC Brueck as coach.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. happen at the same time; be in agreement 同时发生；一致 coincide with  与…同时发生；与…一致
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His arrival in Tokyo coincided with the beginning of the war.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 竞争者，对手
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The bank isn't performing as well as some of its competitors.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  祝贺
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His teachers congratulated him on winning the first prize in the speech contest.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the most important part 核心 hard-core a. 顽固不化的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The core of the problem is their objection to educational reform.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. make (sb.) unable to hear, esp. for a short time 使聋 deaf a. unable to hear at all or to hear well 耳聋的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He was deafened by the noise from the gun.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. giving oneself, time, effort, etc. (to sth.) 奉献，献身 dedicate vt. 献身于，致力于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We admire her courage, compassion and dedication to the cause of humanity, justice and peace.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. small, particular fact or item 细节；琐碎的事
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   No details of the negotiation between the two countries have been revealed.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 鹰
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Eagles wheel in the sky.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. needing little or no effort 容易的，不费力气的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She plays with seemingly effortless skill.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 情感，感情
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Jack is a man of great emotion, easily given to tears.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 爆发 erupt vi.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We still remember the volcanic eruption of Tambora in 1815.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 幻想
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I still have the fantasy that one day I will win the National Lottery.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. using or operated by the fingers 用手的
n. quality of being smooth and elegant , esp. in movement or structure 优美，优雅；雅致
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Classically trained dancers have an extraordinary grace of movement.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 体操家，体操运动员
n. 干草
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   My father is feeding the cattle on hay.

Vocabularies.Definition: 在想象中
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   In his mind's eye, she is still a shy girl.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. fill (sth). with air（使）充气，（使）膨胀
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His lifejacket has failed to inflate.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the state of being intense 强烈，剧烈，紧张
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   In order to finish the job in time, we have to work with greater intensity.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  垫子；席子
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The food is served on tables with mats.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  大众传播媒介
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   They are wondering whether bias in the news media contributed to the candidate's defeat.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. nothing more than 仅仅，只不过
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It's a mere 200 meters from my house to the college.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 格言，座右铭
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   My motto is: "Live each day as it comes."

Vocabularies.Definition: a. very many 许多的，无数的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   During the Depression, numerous people wandered from town to town looking for work.

Vocabularies.Definition: 有一（两，几）次
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   On several occasions, I attempted to talk with my parents about my parents about my taking a part-time job, but my mother instantly interrupted my by asking me questions about my studies.

Vocabularies.Definition: (outran, outrun) vt. run faster or better than; go beyond 跑得比…快；跑得比…好；超过
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The favorite easily outran the other horses in the field.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  strong feeling, esp. of love 热情
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He loved her still, with the same passion as he always had.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the act or process of preparing 准备
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Banks have made adequate preparations for the introduction of the euro, the new common currency in 12 European countries.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.（AmE） 俯卧撑
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He made me do 30 push-ups.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a person who deals in a practical way with situations as they actually are 现实主义者
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Realists would agree with many of these criticisms.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. come or happen again 再来；再发生
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The theme of love recurred n many of his books.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. make or become less tense, worried or nervous 放松，松弛
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The best strategy for avoiding stress is to learn how to relax.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 跑道
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The plane started taxiing（滑行）down the runway.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 资助；赞助
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Private sponsorship only accounted for a third of all arts funding last year.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. run at one's fastest speed, esp. for a short distance 疾跑
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The policeman sprinted to the car.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. give a sudden shock or surprise to 使大吃一惊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You startled me -- I didn't hear you come in.

Vocabularies.Definition: 伸展
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She stretched out a hand to grab the child.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. 出汗 n. 汗水
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She was sweating as she reached the top of the hill.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 起跳；（飞机）起飞
a. feeling worried or nervous; making people worried or nervous 紧张的；令人紧张的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Facing so many teachers, John got very tense and made several mistakes in his recitation.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. worry or nervousness 紧张，不安
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You could feel the tension in the room as we waited for our exam results.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (noise made by) a heavy blow 重击（声）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   There was a loud thump as the horse crashed into the van.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 毛巾，手巾
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She dried the dishes with a clean towel.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. too pleased with one's own abilities or looks 虚荣的，自负的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Too much praise can make a person vain.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 撑杆跳( = pole vault)；撑物跳跃 pole-vault vi., n. 撑杆跳高
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He could easily vault the wall.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  举重（运动）
go through a physical exercise session 体育锻炼，训练
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He used to work out at a gym twice a week.
